paragraphs.text: At the age of 12, I won my very own computer in a story writing competition! This ignited my self taught journey into programming. I only understood half of it but was able to sort-of finish a few projects. A highlight being creating educational software together with my father that taught children how to spell correctly in a playful manner.

paragraphs.html: When I started my music studies, I left programming for a few years. But I had always felt it would come back one day. In 2015, I got an idea for a generative visual, which later evolved into FLUX. This reignited my journey into computers and technology and I was learning new techniques everyday as I went.

paragraphs.text: Spotting the great potential technology and art combined can have, Remco van Dun, Sjoerd Eikenaar and I founded NONLINE. A company that serves as an outlet for our digital creations.

I feel like in programming there is always creativity to be found in finding the most optimal solution to a given problem. Therefore, taking on more and different challenges in the future is something I am looking forward to!
